SENT.plain: The aim of this study was to investigate the usefulness of whole-body MRI(WB-MRI) in the evaluation of cellularity in bone marrow and the distribution of fatty marrow in aplastic anemia
WB-MRI was performed on five patients with aplastic anemia who ranged in age from 62 to 70 years of age, and on four controls with malignant lymphoma who ranged in age from 59 to 67 years

Coronal images were obtained using a body coil with an FOV of 48 cm x 48 cm, and with both fast short T1 inversion recovery(STIR) and spin-echo T1-weighted(T1-WI) in three regions: (1) head to thorax, (2) abdomen to pelvis, and (3) lower extremities
The findings on WB-MRI were compared with those of histological studies of bone marrow at the sternum and the posterior iliac crest

The results were as follows: (1) there was a correlation between the cellularity of histological studies of bone marrow and signal intensity on WB-MRI; (2) WB-MRI could detect the activity of bone marrow; and (3) in a comparison of signal intensity in aplastic anemia and control subjects, there were differences of signal intensity in the central marrow
